value.title: Microsoft Power Platform and low code/no code development: Getting the most out of Fusion Teams
value.excerpt: Microsoft is starting to define a development philosophy for its Power Platform, and delivering the tools needed to back it up.

value.title: Uber’s first head of data science just launched a new venture fund to back nascent AI startups
value.excerpt: Kevin Novak joined Uber as its 21st employee its seventh engineer in 2011, and by 2014, he was the company’s head of data science. He transitioned out of the company in late 2017, after Travis Kalanick had been replaced as CEO by Dara Khosrowshahi.

value.title: InRule: 64% worry about job security while working with AI
value.excerpt: Enterprise decision-makers who work with AI and machine learning are worried about their job security, according to new InRule research.

value.title: A Government Watchdog May Have Missed Clearview AI Use By Five Federal Agencies In A New Report
value.excerpt: In a government accountability report about facial recognition, five federal agencies said they didn't use Clearview AI. Data reviewed by BuzzFeed News suggests they should have.

value.title: A CIO weighs in on how AI can benefit non-technical roles, particularly HR
value.excerpt: Jeff Gregory, the Thirdera CIO, discussed how AI can impact non-technical roles in an organization, especially in the realm of human resources.

value.title: Cheers to the Heineken B.O.T. Self-Driving Beer Delivery Robot
value.excerpt: You could train your dog to grab one for you, which would take effort, time, and commitment. Or you could turn to Heineken's new B.O.T., which is, yep, a beer-carrying robot that brings the beers to you.

value.title: Machine learning helps in predicting when immunotherapy will be effective
value.excerpt: When it comes to defense, the body relies on attack thanks to the lymphatic and immune systems. The immune system is like the body's own personal police force as it hunts down and eliminates pathogenic villains.

value.title: Maine passes ‘strongest’ facial recognition restrictions in the country

value.title: Scaling Blue-Collar AI Ethically And Sustainably
value.excerpt: Developing an AI labor force is similar to building a pyramid. And the mortar holding the entire structure together is ethics.

value.title: This AI Just Evolved From Companion Robot To Home-Based Physician Helper
value.excerpt: The Israeli startup has developed the AI-based, award-winning proactive social robot ElliQ which has spent over 30,000 days in older adults’ homes over the past two years. Now ElliQ will help increase patient engagement while offering primary care providers continuous actionable data and insights for early detection and intervention.

value.title: Israel used world's first AI-guided combat drone swarm in Gaza attacks

value.title: Shenzhen, China’s Silicon Valley, plans to turbocharge local AI development with first-of-a-kind regulations
value.excerpt: Local government departments and state-owned companies will be required to take the lead in using AI products and services to boost implementation of the technology.

value.title: What Investors Should Know About Baidu's AI Chip Spin-Off
value.excerpt: Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU) unveiled Kunlun, its artificial intelligence (AI) chip optimized for cloud-to-edge computing tasks, three years ago. At the time, it claimed the 14nm chip provided 1.5 to three times more processing power than NVIDIA's comparable T4 GPU for AI tasks.

value.title: Industrial AI Is Here, But Is Your Organization Ready For It?
value.excerpt: This readiness checklist should be taken as more of a guidepost, rather than a one-size-fits-all prescription for making your organization AI-ready on day one.
